00054 #define MAX_PROCESSES 32

00063 struct running
00064 {
00065   int pid;             
00066   struct arglist *globals;   
00067   kb_t kb;       
00068   char *name;
00069   struct scheduler_plugin *plugin;
00070   plugins_scheduler_t sched;
00071   struct timeval start;
00072   int timeout;               
00074   int launch_status;
00075   int upstream_soc;
00076   int internal_soc;          
00077   int alive;                 
00078 };
00079 
00080 static void read_running_processes ();
00081 static void update_running_processes ();
00082 
00083 static struct running processes[MAX_PROCESSES];
00084 static int num_running_processes;
00085 static int max_running_processes;
00086 static int old_max_running_processes;
00087 static struct arglist *non_simult_ports_list;

00096 static int
00097 process_internal_msg (int p)
00098 {
00099   int e = 0;
00100   static char *buffer = NULL;
00101   static int bufsz = 0;
00102   int type = 0;
00103 
00104   e = internal_recv (processes[p].internal_soc, &buffer, &bufsz, &type);
00105   if (e < 0)
00106     {
00107       log_write ("Process %d seems to have died too early\n", processes[p].pid);
00108       processes[p].alive = 0;
00109       return -1;
00110     }
00111 
00112   if (type & INTERNAL_COMM_MSG_TYPE_DATA)
00113     {
00114       e = internal_send (processes[p].upstream_soc, buffer, type);
00115     }
00116   else if (type & INTERNAL_COMM_MSG_TYPE_KB)
00117     {
00118       e = 0;
00119       kb_parse (processes[p].internal_soc, processes[p].globals,
00120                 processes[p].kb, buffer, type);
00121     }
00122   else if (type & INTERNAL_COMM_MSG_TYPE_CTRL)
00123     {
00124       if (type & INTERNAL_COMM_CTRL_FINISHED)
00125         {
00126           kill (processes[p].pid, SIGTERM);
00127           processes[p].alive = 0;
00128         }
00129     }
00130   else
00131     log_write ("Received unknown message type %d\n", type);
00132 
00137   if (bufsz > 65535)
00138     efree (&buffer);
00139 
00140   return e;
00141 }

00143 
00147 void
00148 wait_for_children (int sig)
00149 {
00150   int i;
00151   for (i = 0; i < MAX_PROCESSES; i++)
00152     if (processes[i].pid != 0)
00153       {
00154         int ret;
00155         do
00156           {
00157             ret = waitpid (-1, NULL, WNOHANG);
00158           }
00159         while (ret < 0 && errno == EINTR);
00160       }
00161 }
00162 
00163 /*
00164  * Signal management
00165  */
00166 void
00167 process_mgr_sighand_term (int sig)
00168 {
00169   int i;
00170 
00171   for (i = 0; i < MAX_PROCESSES; i++)
00172     {
00173       if (processes[i].pid > 0)
00174         {
00175           kill (processes[i].pid, SIGTERM);
00176           num_running_processes--;
00177           plugin_set_running_state (processes[i].plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_DONE);
00178           close (processes[i].internal_soc);
00179           bzero (&(processes[i]), sizeof (struct running));
00180         }
00181     }
00182   _exit (0);
00183 }
00184 
00188 static void
00189 update_running_processes ()
00190 {
00191   int i;
00192   struct timeval now;
00193   int log_whole = 1;
00194 
00195   for (i = 0; i < MAX_PROCESSES; i++)
00196     {
00197       if (processes[i].globals != NULL)
00198         {
00199           struct arglist *prefs =
00200             arg_get_value (processes[i].globals, "preferences");
00201           log_whole = preferences_log_whole_attack (prefs);
00202           break;
00203         }
00204     }
00205 
00206   gettimeofday (&now, NULL);
00207 
00208   if (num_running_processes == 0)
00209     return;
00210 
00211   for (i = 0; i < MAX_PROCESSES; i++)
00212     {
00213       if (processes[i].pid > 0)
00214         {
00215           // If process dead or timed out
00216           if (processes[i].alive == 0
00217               || (processes[i].timeout > 0
00218                   && ((now.tv_sec - processes[i].start.tv_sec) >
00219                       processes[i].timeout)))
00220             {
00221               if (processes[i].alive)
00222                 {
00223                   struct arglist *desc;
00224                   gchar *msg;
00225                   const char *host;
00226 
00227                   if (log_whole)
00228                     log_write ("%s (pid %d) is slow to finish - killing it\n",
00229                                processes[i].name, processes[i].pid);
00230 
00231                   desc = processes[i].plugin->arglist->value;
00232                   host = plug_get_hostname (desc);
00233                   msg = g_strdup_printf ("SERVER"
00234                                          " <|> ERRMSG"
00235                                          " <|> %s"
00236                                          " <|> general/tcp"
00237                                          " <|> NVT timed out after %d seconds."
00238                                          " <|> %s"
00239                                          " <|> SERVER\n",
00240                                          host ? host : "HOST",
00241                                          processes[i].timeout,
00242                                          arg_get_value (desc, "OID") ? (char *)arg_get_value (desc, "OID") : "0");
00243                   internal_send (processes[i].upstream_soc,
00244                                  msg,
00245                                  INTERNAL_COMM_MSG_TYPE_DATA);
00246                   g_free (msg);
00247 
00248                   terminate_process (processes[i].pid);
00249                   processes[i].alive = 0;
00250                 }
00251               else
00252                 {
00253                   struct timeval old_now = now;
00254                   int e;
00255                   if (now.tv_usec < processes[i].start.tv_usec)
00256                     {
00257                       processes[i].start.tv_sec++;
00258                       now.tv_usec += 1000000;
00259                     }
00260                   if (log_whole)
00261                     log_write
00262                       ("%s (process %d) finished its job in %ld.%.3ld seconds\n",
00263                        processes[i].name, processes[i].pid,
00264                        (long) (now.tv_sec - processes[i].start.tv_sec),
00265                        (long) ((now.tv_usec -
00266                                 processes[i].start.tv_usec) / 1000));
00267                   now = old_now;
00268                   do
00269                     {
00270                       e = waitpid (processes[i].pid, NULL, 0);
00271                     }
00272                   while (e < 0 && errno == EINTR);
00273 
00274                 }
00275               num_running_processes--;
00276               plugin_set_running_state (processes[i].plugin,
00277                                         PLUGIN_STATUS_DONE);
00278 
00279               close (processes[i].internal_soc);
00280               bzero (&(processes[i]), sizeof (processes[i]));
00281             }
00282         }
00283     }
00284 }
00285 
00292 static int
00293 next_free_process (struct scheduler_plugin *upcoming)
00294 {
00295   int r;
00296 
00297   wait_for_children (0);
00298   for (r = 0; r < MAX_PROCESSES; r++)
00299     {
00300       if (processes[r].pid > 0)
00301         {
00302           struct arglist *common_ports;
00303           if ((common_ports =
00304                requirements_common_ports (processes[r].plugin, upcoming)))
00305             {
00306               int do_wait = -1;
00307               if (common (common_ports, non_simult_ports_list))
00308                 do_wait = r;
00309               arg_free (common_ports);
00310               if (do_wait >= 0)
00311                 {
00312 #ifdef DEBUG_CONFLICT
00313                   printf ("Waiting has been initiated...\n");
00314                   log_write ("Ports in common - waiting...\n");
00315 #endif
00316                   while (process_alive (processes[r].pid))
00317                     {
00318                       read_running_processes ();
00319                       update_running_processes ();
00320                       wait_for_children (0);
00321                     }
00322 #ifdef DEBUG_CONFLICT
00323                   printf ("End of the wait - was that long ?\n");
00324 #endif
00325                 }
00326             }
00327         }
00328     }
00329 
00330   // Find the last "living" process.
00331   r = 0;
00332   while ((r < MAX_PROCESSES) && (processes[r].pid > 0))
00333     r++;
00334 
00335   if (r >= MAX_PROCESSES)
00336     return -1;
00337   else
00338     return r;
00339 }
00340 
00344 static void
00345 read_running_processes ()
00346 {
00347   int i;
00348   int flag = 0;
00349   struct timeval tv;
00350   fd_set rd;
00351   int max = 0;
00352   int e;
00353 
00354   if (num_running_processes == 0)
00355     return;
00356 
00357   FD_ZERO (&rd);
00358   for (i = 0; i < MAX_PROCESSES; i++)
00359     {
00360       if (processes[i].pid > 0)
00361         {
00362           FD_SET (processes[i].internal_soc, &rd);
00363           if (processes[i].internal_soc > max)
00364             max = processes[i].internal_soc;
00365         }
00366     }
00367 
00368   do
00369     {
00370       tv.tv_sec = 0;
00371       tv.tv_usec = 500000;
00372       e = select (max + 1, &rd, NULL, NULL, &tv);
00373     }
00374   while (e < 0 && errno == EINTR);
00375 
00376   if (e == 0)
00377     return;
00378 
00379   for (i = 0; i < MAX_PROCESSES; i++)
00380     {
00381       if (processes[i].pid > 0)
00382         {
00383           flag++;
00384           if (FD_ISSET (processes[i].internal_soc, &rd) != 0)
00385             {
00386               int result = process_internal_msg (i);
00387               if (result)
00388                 {
00389 #ifdef DEBUG
00390                   log_write ("process_internal_msg for %s returned %d\n",
00391                              processes[i].name, result);
00392 #endif
00393                 }
00394             }
00395         }
00396     }
00397 
00398   if (flag == 0 && num_running_processes != 0)
00399     num_running_processes = 0;
00400 }
00401 
00402 
00403 void
00404 pluginlaunch_init (struct arglist *globals)
00405 {
00406   struct arglist *preferences = arg_get_value (globals, "preferences");
00407   non_simult_ports_list = arg_get_value (preferences, "non_simult_ports_list");
00408   max_running_processes = get_max_checks_number (preferences);
00409   old_max_running_processes = max_running_processes;
00410 
00411   signal (SIGCHLD, wait_for_children);
00412 
00413   if (max_running_processes >= MAX_PROCESSES)
00414     {
00415       log_write
00416         ("max_checks (%d) > MAX_PROCESSES (%d) - modify openvas-scanner/openvassd/pluginlaunch.c\n",
00417          max_running_processes, MAX_PROCESSES);
00418       max_running_processes = MAX_PROCESSES - 1;
00419     }
00420 
00421 
00422   num_running_processes = 0;
00423   bzero (&(processes), sizeof (processes));
00424   openvas_signal (SIGTERM, process_mgr_sighand_term);
00425 }
00426 
00427 void
00428 pluginlaunch_disable_parrallel_checks ()
00429 {
00430   max_running_processes = 1;
00431 }
00432 
00433 void
00434 pluginlaunch_enable_parrallel_checks ()
00435 {
00436   max_running_processes = old_max_running_processes;
00437 }
00438 
00439 
00440 void
00441 pluginlaunch_stop ()
00442 {
00443   int i;
00444   read_running_processes ();
00445 
00446   for (i = 0; i < MAX_PROCESSES; i++)
00447     {
00448       if (processes[i].pid > 0)
00449         kill (processes[i].pid, SIGTERM);
00450     }
00451 
00452   usleep (20000);
00453   for (i = 0; i < MAX_PROCESSES; i++)
00454     {
00455       if (processes[i].pid > 0)
00456         {
00457           kill (processes[i].pid, SIGKILL);
00458           num_running_processes--;
00459           plugin_set_running_state (processes[i].plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_DONE);
00460           close (processes[i].internal_soc);
00461           bzero (&(processes[i]), sizeof (struct running));
00462         }
00463     }
00464   openvas_signal (SIGTERM, _exit);
00465 }

00467 
00472 int
00473 plugin_launch (struct arglist *globals, plugins_scheduler_t * sched,
00474                struct scheduler_plugin *plugin, struct arglist *hostinfos,
00475                struct arglist *preferences, kb_t kb, char *name)
00476 {
00477   int p;
00478   int dsoc[2];
00479 
00480   /* Wait for a free slot while reading the input from the plugins  */
00481   while (num_running_processes >= max_running_processes)
00482     {
00483       read_running_processes ();
00484       update_running_processes ();
00485     }
00486 
00487   p = next_free_process (plugin);
00488   processes[p].kb = kb;
00489   processes[p].globals = globals;
00490   processes[p].plugin = plugin;
00491   processes[p].sched = sched;
00492   processes[p].name = plugin->arglist->name;
00493   processes[p].launch_status = plug_get_launch (plugin->arglist->value);
00494   processes[p].timeout =
00495     preferences_plugin_timeout (preferences,
00496                                 arg_get_value (plugin->arglist->value, "OID"));
00497   if (processes[p].timeout == 0)
00498     processes[p].timeout = plugin->timeout;
00499 
00500 
00501   // Disable timeout if NVT is a scanner, set it to preferences otherwise
00502   if (processes[p].timeout == 0)
00503     {
00504       int category = plugin->category;
00505       if (category == ACT_SCANNER)
00506         processes[p].timeout = -1;
00507       else
00508         processes[p].timeout = preferences_plugins_timeout (preferences);
00509     }
00510 
00511   if (socketpair (AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, dsoc) < 0)
00512     {
00513       perror ("pluginlaunch.c:plugin_launch:socketpair(1) ");
00514     }
00515   gettimeofday (&(processes[p].start), NULL);
00516 
00517   processes[p].upstream_soc = plugin_get_socket (plugin->arglist->value);
00518   processes[p].internal_soc = dsoc[0];
00519   plugin_set_socket (plugin->arglist->value, dsoc[1]);
00520 
00521   processes[p].pid =
00522     nasl_plugin_launch (globals, plugin->arglist->value, hostinfos,
00523                         preferences, kb, name);
00524 
00525   processes[p].alive = 1;
00526   close (dsoc[1]);
00527   if (processes[p].pid > 0)
00528     num_running_processes++;
00529   else
00530     plugin_set_running_state (processes[p].plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_UNRUN);
00531 
00532   return processes[p].pid;
00533 }

00539 void
00540 pluginlaunch_wait ()
00541 {
00542   do
00543     {
00544       wait_for_children (0);
00545       read_running_processes ();
00546       update_running_processes ();
00547     }
00548   while (num_running_processes != 0);
00549 }
00550 
00551 
00556 void
00557 pluginlaunch_wait_for_free_process ()
00558 {
00559   int num = num_running_processes;
00560   do
00561     {
00562       wait_for_children (0);
00563       read_running_processes ();
00564       update_running_processes ();
00565     }
00566   while (num_running_processes == num);
00567 }
